author: Mohamed Imranullah S
text:
The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Tuesday agreed to file a petition by Wednesday urging the Madras High Court Bench here to issue arrest warrants against the accused who had not engaged counsel to defend an appeal filed by the investigating agency in 2010 against their acquittal from the 2007 Dinakaran newspaper office attack case.

Delaying tactics

Appearing before a Division Bench of Justices P.R. Shivakumar and V.S. Ravi, Assistant Solicitor General G.R. Swaminathan said that the application would be filed on Wednesday as suggested by the High Court during the hearing of the appeal on January 12 after taking serious note of the tactics adopted by the accused to delay the proceedings on one pretext or the other.
title: Dinakaran case: CBI to seek arrest warrant
